mo:topic.mo:text: Without classification
Scoping Review
mo:topic.mo:description:
In addition to all the features of descriptive/narrative reviews, the main features of scoping reviews are:

  • Include gray literature:

mo:topic.mo:text:
Key: WA7YFUPZ
Review type: Scoping Review (by the authors); Types of selected studies: empirical and non-empirical studies
Title: How multidisciplinary is gamification research? Results from a scoping review

Title: Tools for gamification analytics: A survey

mo:comment.text: Structured narrative review?

I don't think these sources are gray literature. I would classify as systematic review

Key: QS7KQ5N5

Title: A scoping review of digital game-based technology on English language learning
Critical Review
mo:topic.mo:description: critical evaluation and interpretive analysis of existing literature on a particular topic of interest to reveal strengths, weaknesses, contradictions, controversies, inconsistencies, and/or other important issues with respect to theories, hypotheses, research methods or results

mo:topic.mo:text:
Key: P2HVLMMV
Review type: systematic literature review (by the authors); Types of selected studies: non-empirical and empirical studies
Title: Gamified crowdsourcing: Conceptualization, literature review, and future agenda

Aggregative Review
mo:topic.mo:description: In an agregative review, there is always a quality assessment of selected studies

mo:comment.text: I didn't understand this category. Is this really needed?

I based on the classification indicated in the chapter


https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK481583/


in which meta-analysis and SLRs are classified as type of aggregative review

mo:topic.mo:text: Systematic Review
mo:topic.mo:description: They frequently used a qualitative method to synthetize the results of primary studies instead to use a meta-analyse

Meta-analysis
mo:topic.mo:description:
The main features in adittion to include a qualitative assessment is:

  • the use of statistical methods to combine the results of independent studies, and to find significant differences

mo:topic.mo:text:
Key: PWFJQCSD
Review type: meta-analysis (by the authors); Types of selected studies: empirical studies
Title: Gamification and serious games: A literature meta-analysis and integrative model

Key: Z25JLEAQ
Review type: meta-analysis (by the authors); Types of selected studies: empirical studies
Title: The effects of gamification on studentsâ€™ academic achievement: a meta-analysis study
Descriptive or Mapping Review
mo:topic.mo:description:
Main features of a descriptive/mapping review

  • it doesn't include a qualitative assessment
  • clear selection and data extraction process
  • each primary study is treated as the unit of analysis and its interpretation is done counting the number of theses units in the published literature as a whole (necessary feature, otherwise the review is structure narrative review)

What reference are you using to not classify as descriptive/mapping study?
This review is a mapping/descriptive review because it doesn't have quality assessment. The results of analysis are described as a text, but not using a data chart or a table

Structured Narrative
mo:topic.mo:description:
A structured narrative is close to similar to a traditional review,

  • its selection and extraction processes may be unclear, with bies, but they are described in the review
  • it doesn't include a qualitative annalysis
  • it frequently uses classification as methods of data synthesis (doesn't uses voting, counting or other)

Title: Gamified Cognitive Bias Modification Interventions for Psychiatric Disorders: Review

mo:comment.text: Descriptive or mapping Review? It follows a clear protocol and has a method for synthetizing the results.

As the number of selected studies was 4, the authors don't make an analysis considered each of these studies as unit of analysis to be comparted with the whole literature - there is not a quality assessment to be considered SLR (according our narrow definition of SLR)

mo:topic.mo:text:
Key: QZ6TGPTD
Review type: Systematic Literature Review (by the authors); Types of selected studies: empirical studies
Title: Accessibility and Gamification Applied to Cognitive Training and Memory Improvement

mo:comment.text: threre is not quality assessment criteria to assess the selected papers

mo:topic.mo:text:
Key: HTG2D2EL
Review type: narrative review (by the authors); Types of selected studies:
Title: Serious gaming as a means of facilitating truly smart cities: a narrative review

mo:insertTopic.mo:text: Scoping Review
mo:insertTopic.mo:description:
In addition to all the features of descriptive/narrative reviews, the main features of scoping reviews are:

  • Include gray literature:

mo:insertTopic.mo:text: Critical Review
mo:insertTopic.mo:description: critical evaluation and interpretive analysis of existing literature on a particular topic of interest to reveal strengths, weaknesses, contradictions, controversies, inconsistencies, and/or other important issues with respect to theories, hypotheses, research methods or results

mo:insertTopic.mo:text: Aggregative Review
mo:insertTopic.mo:description: In an agregative review, there is always a quality assessment of selected studies

mo:insertTopic.mo:text: Descriptive or Mapping Review
mo:insertTopic.mo:description:
Main features of a descriptive/mapping review

  • it doesn't include a qualitative assessment
  • clear selection and data extraction process
  • each primary study is treated as the unit of analysis and its interpretation is done counting the number of theses units in the published literature as a whole (necessary feature, otherwise the review is structure narrative review)

mo:insertTopic.mo:text: Structured Narrative
mo:insertTopic.mo:description:
A structured narrative is close to similar to a traditional review,

  • its selection and extraction processes may be unclear, with bies, but they are described in the review
  • it doesn't include a qualitative annalysis
  • it frequently uses classification as methods of data synthesis (doesn't uses voting, counting or other)

Systematic Review
mo:insertTopic.mo:description: They frequently used a qualitative method to synthetize the results of primary studies instead to use a meta-analyse

mo:insertTopic.mo:text: Meta-analysis
mo:insertTopic.mo:description:
The main features in adittion to include a qualitative assessment is:

  • the use of statistical methods to combine the results of independent studies, and to find significant differences
